contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Yuzawa |JapaneseName= 湯沢町 |settlement_type= [[Town]] |MapImage= Yuzawa in Niigata Prefecture Ja.svg |Region= [[Chubu region|Chubu]] ([[Shinetsu]]) |Prefecture= [[Niigata Prefecture]] |District= |ImageSkyline= Gala Yuzawa 01.jpg |ImageCaption= The Gala Yuzawa ski resort in Yuzawa |Area_km2= 357.00 |PopDate= September 1, 2011 |Population= 8,266 |Density_km2= 23.15 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 36 |LatitudeMinutes= 55 |LatitudeSeconds= 51 |LongtitudeDegrees= 138 |LongtitudeMinutes= 49 |LongtitudeSeconds= 14 |Tree= [[Prunus sargentii]] |Flower= [[Cosmos]] |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Yuzawa Niigata.JPG |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= Kiyotaka Kamimura (since December 2005) |CityHallPostalCode= 949-6192 |CityHallAddress= 300 Kamitate, Yuzawa-machi, Minami-Uonuma-gun, Niigata-ken |CityHallPhone= 025-784-3451 |CityHallLink= [http://www.town.yuzawa.niigata.jp/ Town of Yuzawa] }} {{nihongo|'''Yuzawa'''|湯沢町|Yuzawa-machi}} is an ''[[onsen]]'' ([[hot spring]]) town located in [[Minamiuonuma District, Niigata|Minamiuonuma District]] in the mountains of the Chuetsu region of [[Niigata Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. ==Demographics== As of September 1, 2011, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,266 and a [[population density]] of 23.15 persons per km². The total area is 357.00 km². ==Ski resorts== There are a large number of ski resorts in the area. The town is served by the [[Echigo-Yuzawa Station|Echigo-Yuzawa]] and [[Gala-Yuzawa Station|Gala-Yuzawa]] stations on the [[Jōetsu Shinkansen]] line, making it one of the most easily accessible winter sports areas from [[Tokyo]], and the town's economy is reliant principally on [[skiing]] and [[snowboarding]]. ==Cultural references== [[Yasunari Kawabata]]'s classic novel ''[[Snow Country]]'' takes place in Yuzawa.<ref>Lindelauf, Perrin, "[http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/fv20090118a1.html Finding the fabled Snow Country]", ''[[Japan Times]]'', 18 January 2009, p. 12.</ref> ==See also== * [[Takahan Ryokan]]{{spaced ndash}} an historic inn located in Yuzawa ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category-inline}} * [http://www.town.yuzawa.niigata.jp/ Yuzawa official website] {{ja icon}} *{{wikivoyage-inline|Yuzawa_(Niigata)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2011}} [[Category:Towns in Niigata Prefecture]] [[Category:Spa towns in Japan]]
